items.name: Ibuprofen
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for pain relief and inflammation.

items.name: Naproxen
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for pain relief.

items.name: Diclofenac
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for pain and inflammation.

items.name: Ketorolac
items.notes: Potent Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for short-term pain management.

items.name: Aceclofenac
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for pain relief.

items.name: Aspirin
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID), also used for antiplatelet effects.

items.name: Celecoxib
items.notes: COX-2 selective Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID).

items.name: Etoricoxib
items.notes: COX-2 selective Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID).

items.name: Mefenamic Acid
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for mild to moderate pain.

items.name: Piroxicam
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for pain relief.

items.name: Nimesulide
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for acute pain.

items.name: Lornoxicam
items.notes: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug (NSAID) for pain management.

items.name: Acetaminophen / Paracetamol
items.notes: Analgesic and antipyretic for pain and fever relief.

items.name: Codeine
items.notes: Opioid analgesic for moderate pain.

items.name: Tramadol
items.notes: Opioid analgesic for moderate to severe pain.

items.name: Hydrocodone
items.notes: Opioid analgesic for severe pain.

items.name: Oxycodone
items.notes: Potent opioid analgesic for severe pain.

items.name: Morphine
items.notes: Strong opioid analgesic for severe pain.

items.name: Zerodol-SP
items.notes: Combination of Aceclofenac, Paracetamol, and Serratiopeptidase for pain and inflammation.

items.name: Tolpa D
items.notes: Combination of Paracetamol and Diclofenac.

items.name: Powergesic MR
items.notes: Combination of Diclofenac, Paracetamol, and Chlorzoxazone for pain and muscle spasms.

items.name: Vicoprofen (Hydrocodone + Ibuprofen)
items.notes: Combination opioid and NSAID for pain relief.

items.name: Tylenol #3 (Codeine + Acetaminophen)
items.notes: Combination opioid and analgesic for pain relief.

items.name: Amoxicillin
items.notes: Broad-spectrum penicillin-class antibiotic for bacterial infections.

items.name: Amoxicillin with Clavulanic Acid
items.notes: Penicillin-class antibiotic with beta-lactamase inhibitor (e.g., Augmentin).

items.name: Clindamycin
items.notes: Antibiotic often used for patients with penicillin allergies.

items.name: Azithromycin
items.notes: Macrolide antibiotic, often used for penicillin allergies.

items.name: Metronidazole
items.notes: Antibiotic effective against anaerobic bacteria, often used for dental abscesses.

items.name: Doxycycline
items.notes: Tetracycline-class antibiotic used for infections and periodontal disease.

items.name: Ferric Sulfate
items.notes: Chemical hemostatic agent to control bleeding.

items.name: Ferric Sulfate Hemostatic Gel
items.notes: Viscous ferric sulfate formulation applied with syringes for rapid control of gingival crevicular bleeding.

items.name: Aluminum Chloride
items.notes: Chemical hemostatic agent and gingival retraction agent.

items.name: Aluminum Chloride Hemostatic Gel
items.notes: Thickened aluminum chloride gel ideal for tissue management during crown and bridge impressions.

items.name: Gel Foam Dental Sponge
items.notes: Mechanical hemostatic agent to promote clotting.

items.name: Tannic Acid Hemostatic Paste
items.notes: Astringent tannic acid paste used to coagulate superficial bleeding during restorative procedures.

items.name: Zinc Chloride Hemostatic Paste
items.notes: Strong astringent paste for challenging sulcular bleeding, used with caution to avoid tissue necrosis.

items.name: Epinephrine Retraction Paste
items.notes: Hemostatic retraction paste containing epinephrine for rapid sulcular control prior to impressions.

items.name: Aluminum Chloride Retraction Paste
items.notes: Cartridge-delivered paste that gently retracts tissue while controlling crevicular fluid.

items.name: Ferric Sulfate Retraction Paste
items.notes: Viscous ferric sulfate paste offering displacement and bleeding control for crown and bridge preparations.

items.name: Benzocaine
items.notes: Ester-based topical anesthetic for numbing mucosal surfaces.

items.name: Lidocaine
items.notes: Amide-based topical anesthetic.

items.name: EMLA Cream (Lidocaine + Prilocaine)
items.notes: Combination amide-based topical anesthetic cream.

items.name: Mucopain Gel
items.notes: High-strength benzocaine gel for rapid topical anesthesia before minor oral procedures.

items.name: Orajel Benzocaine Gel
items.notes: Over-the-counter benzocaine gel used for temporary relief of oral pain and teething discomfort.

items.name: Anbesol Maximum Strength Gel
items.notes: Topical benzocaine gel providing temporary relief from toothache, sore gums, and denture irritation.

items.name: Hurricane Topical Anesthetic Gel
items.notes: Chairside benzocaine gel for numbing mucosa prior to injections, scaling, or minor procedures.

items.name: Topex Topical Anesthetic Gel
items.notes: Flavored benzocaine gel applied before injections or prophylaxis for enhanced patient comfort.

items.name: Viscous Lidocaine 2%
items.notes: Thickened lidocaine solution swished or dabbed for mucosal anesthesia in ulcers and procedural sites.

items.name: Xylocaine Topical Gel
items.notes: Lidocaine gel applied to oral mucosa for localized anesthesia and relief from irritations.

items.name: Lidocaine Gel 8%
items.notes: Concentrated lidocaine gel compounded for patients requiring enhanced topical anesthesia prior to instrumentation.

items.name: Lidocaine Gel 60%
items.notes: Ultra-high potency lidocaine gel reserved for severe neuropathic oral pain under specialist supervision.

items.name: Cetacaine Gel
items.notes: Combination topical anesthetic gel offering rapid-onset mucosal anesthesia for periodontal and surgical care.

items.name: Dyclonine Hydrochloride Gel
items.notes: Ketone-based topical anesthetic alternative for patients sensitive to ester or amide agents.

items.name: Lidocaine with Epinephrine
items.notes: Local injectable anesthetic with vasoconstrictor.

items.name: Articaine with Epinephrine
items.notes: Local injectable anesthetic with vasoconstrictor, known for good bone penetration.

items.name: Chlorhexidine Gluconate Mouthwash
items.notes: Antiseptic and disinfectant oral rinse (e.g., Peridex, PerioGard).

items.name: PerioChip
items.notes: A small chip containing chlorhexidine gluconate placed in periodontal pockets.

items.name: Povidone Iodine
items.notes: Iodine-based antiseptic for disinfection.

items.name: Hydrogen Peroxide
items.notes: Oxidizing agent used for rinsing and debridement.

items.name: Prednisone / Prednisolone
items.notes: Systemic corticosteroid for severe inflammation.

items.name: Dexamethasone
items.notes: Potent systemic corticosteroid.

items.name: Triamcinolone Acetonide Paste
items.notes: Topical corticosteroid paste for oral lesions (e.g., Kenalog in Orabase).

items.name: Kenalog in Orabase
items.notes: Adhesive corticosteroid paste in an orabase vehicle for recurrent aphthous ulcers and inflammatory lesions.

items.name: Oralone Dental Paste
items.notes: Triamcinolone dental paste that adheres to oral mucosa to reduce inflammation and discomfort.

items.name: Fluocinonide Oral Gel
items.notes: High-potency corticosteroid gel prescribed for erosive lichen planus and recalcitrant aphthous ulcers.

items.name: Clobetasol Propionate Oral Gel
items.notes: Ultra-potent steroid gel used short-term for severe immune-mediated oral mucosal diseases.

items.name: Clobetasol in Orabase
items.notes: Compounded clobetasol paste in an orabase adhesive for localized treatment of erosive lesions.

items.name: Dexamethasone Elixir
items.notes: Swish-and-spit corticosteroid rinse used for diffuse inflammatory oral conditions and mucositis.

items.name: Fluocinolone Acetonide Gel
items.notes: Medium-potency steroid gel applied to oral mucosa for symptomatic relief of autoimmune lesions.

items.name: Betamethasone Valerate Gel
items.notes: Topical steroid gel providing anti-inflammatory action for aphthous ulcers and desquamative gingivitis.

items.name: Hydrocortisone Dental Ointment
items.notes: Mild topical corticosteroid ointment for minor oral irritations and angular cheilitis flare-ups.

items.name: Fluconazole
items.notes: Systemic antifungal medication for treating oral thrush (candidiasis).

items.name: Nystatin
items.notes: Antifungal medication, also available as a liquid rinse.

items.name: Acyclovir
items.notes: Antiviral medication for herpes virus infections (e.g., cold sores).

items.name: Penciclovir Cream 1%
items.notes: Topical antiviral cream indicated for recurrent herpes labialis lesions.

items.name: Acyclovir Cream 5%
items.notes: Topical acyclovir formulation for episodic management of herpes labialis outbreaks.

items.name: Docosanol Cream 10%
items.notes: Over-the-counter fusion inhibitor cream (Abreva) that shortens duration of cold sores.

items.name: Hydrocortisone Lip Balm
items.notes: Mild steroid lip preparation to reduce inflammation from cheilitis and post-herpetic irritation.

items.name: Nitroglycerin
items.notes: Emergency drug for angina (chest pain).

items.name: Salbutamol Inhaler
items.notes: Emergency drug for bronchospasm or asthma attack.

items.name: Epinephrine
items.notes: Emergency drug for anaphylaxis (severe allergic reaction).

items.name: Pheniramine Maleate (Avil)
items.notes: Antihistamine for allergic reactions.

items.name: Glucose Powder
items.notes: Emergency treatment for hypoglycemia (low blood sugar).

items.name: Diazepam (Valium)
items.notes: Benzodiazepine for anxiety, sedation, or seizure management.

items.name: Triazolam (Halcion)
items.notes: Benzodiazepine for sedation before dental procedures.

items.name: Pilocarpine
items.notes: Medication to increase saliva production for dry mouth (xerostomia).

items.name: Artificial Saliva Products
items.notes: Over-the-counter or prescription products to relieve dry mouth.

items.name: Artificial Saliva Gel
items.notes: Viscous saliva substitute formulated with carboxymethylcellulose or hydroxyethylcellulose for lasting moisture.

items.name: Moi-Stir Oral Moisturizing Gel
items.notes: Saliva substitute gel that coats oral tissues and provides sustained relief from xerostomia.

items.name: Mouth Kote Gel
items.notes: Xylitol-containing saliva substitute gel that stimulates residual salivary function while lubricating tissues.

items.name: Optimoist Oral Gel
items.notes: Moisturizing gel formulated with cellulose derivatives to reduce discomfort from persistent xerostomia.

items.name: Xero-Lube Gel
items.notes: Neutral pH saliva substitute gel used by denture wearers and radiotherapy patients to lubricate oral tissues.

items.name: Salix Oral Hydrating Gel
items.notes: Hydroxyethylcellulose-based gel that offers lasting moisture and relief from dry mouth discomfort.

items.name: Fluoride Varnish
items.notes: Professionally applied topical fluoride for caries prevention.

items.name: Omeprazole
items.notes: Proton Pump Inhibitor (PPI) to reduce stomach acid, can be relevant for dental erosion from GERD.

items.name: Serratiopeptidase
items.notes: Anti-inflammatory enzyme often combined with NSAIDs to reduce swelling.

items.name: Rexidin-M Forte Mouthwash
items.notes: Combination chlorhexidine gluconate and metronidazole mouth rinse for periodontal infections.

items.name: Benzydamine Hydrochloride Mouthwash
items.notes: Anti-inflammatory and analgesic oral rinse for mucositis and sore throat relief (e.g., Tantum).

items.name: Sodium Fluoride Mouthrinse
items.notes: Topical fluoride mouthwash for enamel remineralization and caries prevention.

items.name: Hexigel (Chlorhexidine Dental Gel)
items.notes: Chlorhexidine gluconate gel used as a topical antiseptic for gingivitis and periodontal pockets.

items.name: Metrogyl DG Gel
items.notes: Metronidazole and chlorhexidine combination dental gel for anaerobic infections in periodontal pockets.

items.name: Dologel-CT Oral Gel
items.notes: Choline salicylate and lignocaine hydrochloride gel for teething discomfort and aphthous ulcers.

items.name: Orasore Mouth Ulcer Gel
items.notes: Combination gel that soothes aphthous ulcers, teething pain, and minor oral irritations.

items.name: Bonjela Oral Gel
items.notes: Over-the-counter mouth ulcer gel that relieves pain and reduces inflammation in oral mucosa.

items.name: Dentogel Mouth Ulcer Gel
items.notes: Multi-ingredient oral gel formulated to ease pain and accelerate healing of mouth ulcers.

items.name: Olergel Mouth Ulcer Gel
items.notes: Prescription ulcer gel combining anti-inflammatory and antiseptic agents for recurrent aphthous ulcers.

items.name: Coolrap Mouth Ulcer Gel
items.notes: Cooling oral gel with analgesic and protective ingredients for canker sores and denture sore spots.

items.name: Miconazole Oral Gel
items.notes: Topical antifungal gel for oral candidiasis and angular cheilitis.

items.name: Miconazole with Chlorhexidine Gel
items.notes: Dual-action gel that combines antifungal and antiseptic activity for denture stomatitis and periodontal pockets.

items.name: Chlorhexidine Gluconate Gel 0.2%
items.notes: Low-strength chlorhexidine gel applied to gingiva for plaque control and gingivitis management.

items.name: Chlorhexidine Periodontal Gel 2%
items.notes: High-concentration chlorhexidine gel placed in periodontal pockets for sustained antimicrobial effect.

items.name: Peridex Periodontal Gel
items.notes: Prescription chlorhexidine gel formulated for localized delivery to periodontal sites after scaling and root planing.

items.name: Hexidine Dental Gel
items.notes: Chlorhexidine-based dental gel indicated for adjunctive treatment of gingivitis and periodontal infections.

items.name: Clorni Dental Gel
items.notes: Combination antimicrobial gel for management of chronic periodontitis and gingival inflammation.

items.name: Povidone-Iodine Oral Gel
items.notes: Broad-spectrum antiseptic gel for pre-procedural disinfection and management of infected oral lesions.

items.name: Metronidazole Dental Gel
items.notes: Topical nitroimidazole gel applied in periodontal pockets to target anaerobic bacteria.

items.name: Clindamycin Dental Gel
items.notes: Lincosamide antibiotic gel compounded for refractory periodontal infections and localized osteitis.

items.name: Clotrimazole Lozenges
items.notes: Antifungal lozenges for treating oral candidiasis.

items.name: Nystatin Topical Cream
items.notes: Polyene antifungal cream for angular cheilitis and perioral candidiasis associated with dentures.

items.name: Nystatin Topical Ointment
items.notes: Adherent antifungal ointment for lip commissures, denture sore areas, and neonatal thrush lesions.

items.name: Nystatin with Triamcinolone Ointment
items.notes: Combination antifungal and corticosteroid ointment to manage inflammatory fungal infections around the mouth.

items.name: Miconazole Dental Gel
items.notes: Oral mucosal gel for candidiasis that may be preferred when nystatin resistance or intolerance occurs.

items.name: Clotrimazole Topical Cream
items.notes: Imidazole antifungal cream used on labial commissures and perioral tissues affected by candidal infections.

items.name: Ketoconazole Topical Cream
items.notes: Broad-spectrum azole cream for chronic oral candidiasis affecting mucosal and perioral tissues.

items.name: Fluconazole Oral Gel
items.notes: Compounded fluconazole gel for resistant oral thrush or when systemic therapy is contraindicated.

items.name: Iodoquinol with Hydrocortisone Cream
items.notes: Antifungal and corticosteroid combination cream for angular cheilitis and inflammatory perioral infections.

items.name: Soft-Bristle Toothbrush
items.notes: Patient home-care toothbrush with soft bristles to reduce abrasion of enamel and gingiva.

items.name: Interdental Brush
items.notes: Small brush designed to clean interdental spaces and orthodontic appliances.

items.name: Waxed Dental Floss
items.notes: Wax-coated dental floss for plaque removal between teeth.

items.name: Tongue Cleaner
items.notes: Tool used to mechanically remove debris and bacteria from the dorsal surface of the tongue.

items.name: Chlorhexidine Gluconate Mouthwash 0.2%
items.notes: Higher strength chlorhexidine mouthrinse used for short-term intensive plaque control and post-surgical care.

items.name: Essential Oil Mouthrinse (Listerine)
items.notes: Combination of thymol, eucalyptol, methyl salicylate, and menthol for broad-spectrum plaque and gingivitis reduction.

items.name: Cetylpyridinium Chloride Mouthwash
items.notes: Quaternary ammonium compound rinse for halitosis management and plaque control (e.g., Colgate Plax).

items.name: Tranexamic Acid Mouthrinse
items.notes: Antifibrinolytic mouthwash prescribed to minimize post-operative bleeding, especially in anticoagulated patients.

items.name: Sodium Bicarbonate Mouth Rinse
items.notes: Mild alkaline rinse prepared chairside for mucositis comfort and neutralization of oral acids.

items.name: Benzydamine Hydrochloride Oral Spray
items.notes: Topical nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory spray that relieves oral mucosal pain and inflammation.

items.name: Amlexanox Oral Paste
items.notes: Prescription topical anti-inflammatory paste for recurrent aphthous ulcers and Behçet lesions.

items.name: Orabase Protective Paste
items.notes: Carboxymethylcellulose-based paste that forms a protective barrier over oral ulcers and sore spots.

items.name: Zilactin Protective Gel
items.notes: Film-forming gel that seals canker sores to reduce irritation from eating, drinking, and speaking.

items.name: Sucralfate Oral Suspension
items.notes: Mucosal coating agent used off-label for oral mucositis and ulcer discomfort.

items.name: Sucralfate Oral Paste
items.notes: Adherent paste compounded from sucralfate tablets to form a protective barrier over painful mucosal ulcers.

items.name: Aluminum-Magnesium Antacid Paste
items.notes: Soothing antacid paste mixed with local anesthetic for symptomatic relief of aphthous ulcers and mucositis.

items.name: Becaplermin Gel
items.notes: Recombinant platelet-derived growth factor gel sometimes used off-label to promote healing of refractory oral wounds.

items.name: Silver Sulfadiazine Cream
items.notes: Topical antimicrobial cream used post-operatively to prevent infection and aid healing in oral burns and graft sites.

items.name: Calendula Ointment
items.notes: Herbal ointment providing soothing anti-inflammatory effects for minor oral mucosal injuries.

items.name: Aloe Vera Oral Gel
items.notes: Bioactive aloe gel applied to oral tissues to reduce inflammation, promote healing, and provide moisture.

items.name: Serratiopeptidase Topical Gel
items.notes: Proteolytic enzyme gel used to reduce localized swelling and inflammation following oral surgery.

items.name: Trypsin-Chymotrypsin Enzyme Gel
items.notes: Combined proteolytic enzymes formulated to debride necrotic tissue and accelerate mucosal healing.

items.name: Bromelain Oral Gel
items.notes: Pineapple-derived enzyme gel employed for its anti-inflammatory and edema-reducing properties.

items.name: Papain Oral Debridement Gel
items.notes: Papaya enzyme gel that gently debrides fibrinous slough on oral ulcers to facilitate healing.

items.name: Hyaluronic Acid Oral Gel
items.notes: Moisturizing gel that accelerates soft tissue repair and reduces inflammation in periodontal lesions.

items.name: Collagen Wound Dressing Gel
items.notes: Topical collagen matrix gel supporting granulation and epithelialization in oral surgical sites.

items.name: Platelet-Rich Plasma Gel
items.notes: Autologous plasma gel rich in growth factors applied post-surgically to enhance soft-tissue regeneration.

items.name: Topical Growth Factor Gel
items.notes: Biologically active gel containing recombinant growth factors to stimulate angiogenesis and epithelial repair.

items.name: Neomycin-Bacitracin Antibiotic Ointment
items.notes: Topical antibiotic ointment applied post-surgically to reduce risk of secondary infection at extraoral sites.

items.name: Chlorhexidine Post-Surgical Gel
items.notes: Bioadhesive chlorhexidine gel dispensed after periodontal surgery to maintain antimicrobial protection.

items.name: Vitamin E Healing Ointment
items.notes: Topical tocopherol ointment used to nourish epithelium and minimize scarring after oral procedures.

items.name: Centella Asiatica Oral Gel
items.notes: Botanical gel rich in asiaticoside to promote angiogenesis and collagen synthesis during mucosal repair.

items.name: Plastibase Compounding Base
items.notes: Thermoplastic polyethylene and mineral oil base used to prepare stable custom dental ointments.

items.name: Orabase Mucoadhesive Base
items.notes: Gelatin-pectin-carboxymethylcellulose base that adheres to mucosa and serves as a vehicle for medicated pastes.

items.name: Carbomer Gel Base
items.notes: Neutralized carbomer polymer base utilized for compounding viscous oral gels with uniform drug dispersion.

items.name: Hydroxypropyl Cellulose Gel Base
items.notes: Bioadhesive cellulose derivative base that provides sustained release of active agents on mucosal surfaces.

items.name: Petrolatum Ointment Base
items.notes: Occlusive hydrocarbon base commonly used to compound custom lip and mucosal ointments.

items.name: Choline Salicylate Oral Gel
items.notes: Anti-inflammatory oral gel for teething discomfort, aphthous ulcers, and sore gums.

items.name: Lignocaine Oral Spray 10%
items.notes: Topical anesthetic spray for gag reflex suppression and minor oral procedures.

items.name: Orthodontic Relief Wax
items.notes: Soft wax provided to orthodontic patients to cushion brackets and wires from oral mucosa.

items.name: Denture Adhesive Cream
items.notes: Polymer cream that improves denture retention and comfort for removable prosthesis wearers.

items.name: Denture Cleansing Tablets
items.notes: Effervescent alkaline peroxide tablets for daily soaking and decontamination of dentures.

items.name: Desensitizing Toothpaste (Potassium Nitrate 5%)
items.notes: Potassium nitrate toothpaste recommended for dentin hypersensitivity relief.

items.name: Potassium Nitrate Desensitizing Paste
items.notes: Chairside potassium nitrate paste applied to exposed dentin prior to bonding or whitening procedures.

items.name: Arginine Calcium Carbonate Paste
items.notes: Professional desensitizing paste that occludes dentinal tubules using arginine and calcium carbonate technology.

items.name: Calcium Phosphate Remineralizing Paste
items.notes: Bioavailable calcium and phosphate paste (e.g., NovaMin) for hypersensitivity relief and enamel repair.

items.name: Calcium Hydroxide Paste
items.notes: Intracanal medicament providing high pH antibacterial action during endodontic therapy.

items.name: Iodoform Root Canal Paste
items.notes: Radiopaque iodine-based paste used for primary tooth pulpectomies and persistent periapical infections.

items.name: Zinc Oxide Eugenol Paste
items.notes: Sedative dressing and temporary cement providing obtundant effect on inflamed pulpal tissues.

items.name: Formocresol Pulp Dressing
items.notes: Fixative dressing historically used in pulpotomy procedures; now limited to specific pediatric indications.

items.name: Stannous Fluoride Toothpaste
items.notes: Stannous fluoride dentifrice that offers anti-caries, anti-gingivitis, and sensitivity benefits.

items.name: Carbamide Peroxide Whitening Gel
items.notes: Take-home bleaching gel dispensed in custom trays for gradual whitening of vital teeth.

items.name: Hydrogen Peroxide In-Office Gel
items.notes: Professionally applied whitening gel activated chairside for rapid shade improvement.

items.name: Potassium Nitrate Desensitizing Gel
items.notes: Adjunct gel used alongside bleaching to reduce post-whitening sensitivity and calm exposed dentin.

items.name: CPP-ACP Remineralizing Cream
items.notes: Casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate cream (e.g., GC Tooth Mousse) for enamel remineralization.

items.name: Silver Diamine Fluoride
items.notes: Topical agent used to arrest active dental caries and reduce dentin hypersensitivity.

items.name: Acidulated Phosphate Fluoride Gel
items.notes: In-office professional fluoride gel applied in trays for caries prevention.

items.name: Neutral Sodium Fluoride Gel
items.notes: Professional fluoride gel recommended for patients with porcelain restorations or xerostomia.

items.name: Xylitol Chewing Gum
items.notes: Sugar-free gum sweetened with xylitol to stimulate salivary flow and reduce mutans streptococci.

items.name: Probiotic Lozenges (Streptococcus salivarius K12)
items.notes: Oral probiotic lozenges formulated to improve oral microbiome balance and reduce halitosis.

items.name: Vitamin B Complex Capsules
items.notes: Supplement frequently prescribed for glossitis, angular cheilitis, and oral neuropathies.

items.name: Oraqix Periodontal Gel
items.notes: Thermally sensitive periodontal gel that becomes viscous in the sulcus to provide needle-free anesthesia during scaling and root planing.

items.name: Dentipatch Topical Patch
items.notes: Mucoadhesive lidocaine patch applied to oral mucosa for localized anesthetic delivery prior to injections.

items.name: Alveogyl Dry Socket Dressing
items.notes: Iodoform, butamben, and eugenol impregnated paste for soothing and disinfecting extraction sockets affected by alveolar osteitis.

items.name: Traxodent Hemostatic Retraction Paste
items.notes: Cartridge-delivered retraction paste that expands with kaolin to gently displace tissue while controlling sulcular fluid.

items.name: Expasyl Gingival Retraction Paste
items.notes: Kaolin-based retraction paste offering atraumatic gingival displacement and hemostasis prior to impression making.

items.name: Biotene Oralbalance Gel
items.notes: Enzyme-enriched saliva substitute gel providing long-lasting lubrication for xerostomia sufferers.

items.name: PreviDent 5000 Booster Plus
items.notes: High-fluoride prescription toothpaste for high-caries-risk patients needing intensive remineralization.

items.name: Clinpro 5000 Toothpaste
items.notes: Tri-calcium phosphate enhanced prescription toothpaste that releases calcium and phosphate with fluoride for enamel repair.

items.name: MI Paste Plus
items.notes: Casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate cream with fluoride for remineralization and sensitivity relief.

items.name: Enamelon Preventive Treatment Gel
items.notes: Professional gel delivering stabilized stannous fluoride and amorphous calcium phosphate to strengthen enamel and reduce sensitivity.
